dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4241 IH: Syria Sanctions Relief Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Omar (for herself and Mrs. Luna) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on the Judiciary, and Financial Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To repeal sanctions with respect to the Syrian Arab Republic, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Syria Sanctions Relief Act.

section.header: Repeal of measures with respect to the Syrian Arab Republic

subsection.header: Repeal of the Syria Human Rights Accountability Act of 2012

paragraph.text: Title VII of the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012 (22 U.S.C. 8791 et seq.) is repealed.
The table of contents for such Act is amended by striking the items relating to title VII.

subsection.header: Repeal of the Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act of 2019
subsection.text: Title LXXIV of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2020 (Public Law 116â€“92) is repealed.
